data: Goal 3. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages3.7 By 2030, ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services, including for family planning, information and education, and ensure that the reproductive health in national strategies and programs3.7.1.a) Modern contraceptive prevalence rate for women aged 15-492020ISTEEBUNDAYISENGA ModestDepartment of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODDHead of Service and Focal Point79401937ndayimode2010@gmail.comIt is the ratio of women aged 15 to 49 who use a contraceptive method to all women aged 15 to 49 during the year.%EDSB-III, 2016-2017Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaireThe probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)In 2022ISTEEBUISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national levelISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.(Number of women aged 15 to 49 who use a contraceptive method in the given year divided by the total number of women aged 15 to 49 minus the number of expected pregnancies during the year) multiplied by 100The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publicationThe indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international levelReport of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017
